ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tonic Tensor Tympanic Syndrome (TTTS)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports 'fluttering' sensation, aural pressure, and sound sensitivity following acoustic shock; previous ENT diagnosis confirmed.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Subjective Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Primary complaint of bilateral ringing, worse in the right ear, with catastrophic reaction on TRQ.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports sound sensitivity in the right ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Anxiety and Depression
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant comorbidities exacerbating symptoms; patient stopped attending school due to distress.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To inspect ear canals for obstruction or pathology.
To assess retrocochlear function and middle ear muscle reflexes.
To assess speech reception and recognition.
To evaluate functional hearing in noise (QuickSIN).
To characterize tinnitus pitch, loudness, and maskability.
To quantify the impact of tinnitus on quality of life (TRQ).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation revealed normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally with excellent word recognition and normal speech-in-noise ability. Middle ear function was normal, including type A tympanograms and normal acoustic reflexes. Tinnitus evaluation indicated a pitch match of 6000 Hz and a catastrophic reaction (TRQ score 88), with symptoms consistent with Tonic Tensor Tympanic Syndrome exacerbated by significant anxiety.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity (250-8000 Hz) bilaterally; PTA 13 dB HL (right) and 12 dB HL (left).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal thresholds in both ipsilateral and contralateral conditions.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs consistent with PTA (10 dB HL right, 15 dB HL left); WRS excellent (92% right, 96% left) at 55 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: QuickSIN at 60 dBA showed 2 dB SNR loss (normal).

tests.name: Tinnitus Evaluation
tests.result_summary: Pitch match 6000 Hz; Loudness match 22 dB SL; Minimum masking level 23 dB SL; Partial residual inhibition.

tests.name: Self-Report Scales
tests.result_summary: Tinnitus Reaction Questionnaire (TRQ) score 88/104, indicating Grade 5 (Catastrophic) reaction.

proposed_items: Sound therapy using a smartphone app or sound generator
Recommendation for ultra-high-frequency audiometry for additional information
counseling_actions: Extensive counseling on the mechanisms of tinnitus, common causes, and treatments
Explanation of Tonic Tensor Tympanic Syndrome (TTTS) to reduce anxiety regarding the diagnosis
Discussion of the link between anxiety/depression and tinnitus/TTTS
Reassurance regarding normal hearing test results and lack of anatomical abnormalities
Discussion of least invasive treatment options as requested by the patient

escalation.rationale_short: Patient exhibits catastrophic tinnitus reaction and significant anxiety/depression affecting daily life (school dropout).

follow_up_plan.objective: Patient to return with any new symptoms or concerns; follow-up with mental health professional encouraged.

expected_outcome: Patient reported a decrease in anxiety about his condition following extensive counseling and explanation of the diagnosis.
Patient expressed the desire to follow-up with a mental health professional and reported he would utilize a sound generator at home.
Patient reported he felt he would be able to return to school with some relief.
